Package com.gerard.site.dao.connection

Class ConnectionPool

java.lang.Object
com.gerard.site.dao.connection.ConnectionPool
public final class ConnectionPool extends Object
Final class that manages (gives out and gets back) specified fixed quantity of database connections which are instance of custom class ProxyConnection ProxyConnection .

Uses connection properties from class ConnectionProperties ConnectionProperties through MySQL JDBC drivers com.mysql.cj.jdbc . Realized as thread-safe singleton object .

Database connections are storing in two queues:

  1. free connections queue
  2. given connections queue

Giving out connections method giveOutConnection() takes connections from free connection queue and put it to the given connections queue.

Getting back method getBackConnection(Connection) ()} works otherwise, it takes connections from given connections queue and puts it to the free connections queue .

Can but no guarantee protection from leaking connections , cause database connections has timeout .

Connections may be destroyed by using method destroy() destroy() .

Singleton pattern realized through using AtomicBoolean object AtomicBoolean

Version:
1.0
Author:
Liliya Siadzelnikava

    • getInstance

      public static ConnectionPool getInstance()

      Returns:
      initialized pool instance

    • giveOutConnection

      public Connection giveOutConnection() throws ConnectionException
      Gives out database connection from connection pool. Firstly gives connection from free connections queue then put it to given connections queue. If no free connection exists waits

      For thread-safeness uses take() BlockingQueue.take() and put(Object) BlockingQueue.put(Object) methods of BlockingQueue class

      If called while pool destroy process interrupts that thread and throws ConnectionException ConnectionException . If this implementation is used it's recommended to use transactions to protect of data corrupting .
      Returns:
      taken connection from free connection queue. If no free connection exists wait .
      Throws:
      ConnectionException - if method called while pool destroy executing

    • getBackConnection

      public boolean getBackConnection​(Connection connection) throws ConnectionException
      Gets back connection to connection pool. Firstly check if connection instanceof ProxyConnection ProxyConnection if no throws ConnectionException ConnectionException . Then takes it from given connections queue and put to free connections queue .

      If removing connection from given connections or putting it to the free connections queue is impossible replaces it by the new one .

      Parameters:
      connection - to get back to pool
      Returns:
      false if param connection is not instanceof ProxyConnection ProxyConnection true if connection was successfully put to free connections queue
      Throws:
      ConnectionException - if catches InterruptedException which can be thrown while putting connection into free connection queue by using method put of BlockingQueue class BlockingQueue.put(Object)
      See Also:
      ProxyConnection

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroys pool by removing connections from free connections queue and really close connections by calling close() method in Connection class Connection.close() . Given connections in given connections queue are not closing cause

      Deregister JDBC drivers in finally block . Used not-thread safe queue method remove() Queue.remove()
